intro: Ligusticum rotundatum, commonly known as Chinese lovage, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the family, and its roots are often used in traditional medicine. Ligusticum rotundatum is valued for its medicinal properties, including potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
